00004 assembly* load_pdb(char* file_name)
00005 {
00006   char* temp;
00007   WARN=1;SILENT=1;INWC=0;DATE=0;UNCUT=1;UNx=1;UNy=1;UNz=1;
00008   temp = suf; strcpy(temp,".pdb");
00009   temp = sufc; strcpy(temp,"_change.txt"); ACT='0';
00010   DEBUG=-1;LASTRES=-1;LASTOKX=0;LASTOKY=0;LASTOKZ=0;
00011   UNCTOL=0;CRYX=0;CRYY=0;CRYZ=0;LASTX=0;LASTY=0;LASTZ=0;
00012   //int resNum;
00013   int ma;
00014   //molecule* mol;
00015   assembly* asmbl;
00016   IN = myfopen(file_name, "r");
00017  /*scans pdb file for number of lines
00018   allocates memory for line structures
00019   initializes structures that contain line formats*/
00020   init_struct();
00021   rewind(IN);
00022   //Read in lines to ln structure
00023   printf("Reading in %s...\n",file_name);
00024   for(ma=0;ma<INWC;ma++){
00025   if(DEBUG>=1){printf("made it to here main line loop %d ...\n", ma);} 
00026         rwm_line(ma+1);
00027         }
00028   //Determine the number of molecules in the pdb
00029   printf("There are %d molecule(s)\n",howManyMolecules());
00030   asmbl = getAssembly();
00031   printf("PDB Information Successfully Read.\n");
00032   free(ln);
00033   return asmbl;
00034 }
00035 
00036 int howManyMolecules()
00037 {
00038  int i; int counter = 0;
00039 
00040  for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00041   if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)//If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00042    counter++;
00043  if(counter == 0 || isAtom(ln+(INWC-1)) == 1)
00044   counter ++;
00045  return counter;
00046 }

00048 assembly* getAssembly()
00049 {
00050   int molNum = howManyMolecules();
00051   int i = 0;int j = 0;int k = 0;int l = 0;int atom_num;double x,y,z;
00052   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; char* atmName = name;
00053   assembly* asmbl = (assembly*) malloc (1 * sizeof(assembly));
00054   (*asmbl).nm = molNum;
00055   molecule* mol = (molecule*) malloc (molNum * sizeof(molecule));
00056   (*asmbl).m = (molecule**)calloc(1,sizeof(molecule*));//added by MNT on 20080806
00057   (*asmbl).m[0] = mol; // changed by BLF on 20080622 -- might need revisiting
00058   molecule* curMol; residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00059   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00060   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00061   curMol = (mol+j);
00062   (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i);
00063   (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00064   getResInfo((*curMol).r,i);
00065   curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00066   (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00067   curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00068   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00069   {
00070     //If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00071     if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)
00072     {
00073       j++;
00074       curMol = (mol+j);
00075       (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i+1);
00076       (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00077       getResInfo((*curMol).r,i+1);
00078       curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00079       k = 0;l = 0;
00080       (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00081       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00082     }
00083     else if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00084     {
00085       if(l == (*curRes).na)
00086       {
00087        k++;l = 0;
00088        curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00089        (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom)); 
00090        //curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00091       }
00092       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00093       //Getting the atom #
00094       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c;
00095       sscanf(temp,"%d",&atom_num);
00096       //Getting the atom name
00097       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c;
00098       sscanf(temp,"%s",atmName);
00099       //Getting the X coordinate
00100       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c;
00101       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&x);
00102       //Getting the Y coordinate
00103       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c;
00104       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&y);
00105       //Getting the Z coordinate
00106       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c;
00107       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&z);   
00108 
00109       (*curAtm).n = atom_num;//set the atom #
00110       (*curAtm).N = strdup(atmName);//set the atom name
00111       //set the atom's coordinates
00112       (*curAtm).x.i = x; (*curAtm).x.j = y; (*curAtm).x.k = z;
00113       l++;
00114     }
00115   }
00116  return asmbl;
00117 }

00119 int findTotalResidue(int start)
00120 {
00121   int ret = 0;int i = start;int curRes = 0;int thisRes;
00122   char* temp;
00123   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00124   {
00125     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00126     {
00127       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00128       sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00129       if(thisRes != curRes)
00130       { 
00131         ret ++;
00132         curRes = thisRes;
00133       }
00134     }
00135    i++;
00136   }
00137   return ret;
00138 }

00140 int endOfMol(linedef* line)
00141 {
00142   if(((*line).a == 4 && (*line).b == 2)||
00143      ((*line).a == 2 && ((*line).b == 9||(*line).b == 3)))
00144     return 1;
00145   else
00146     return 0;
00147 }
00148 
00149 int isAtom(linedef* line)
00150 {
00151   if(((*line).a == 2 || (*line).a == 3) && (*line).b == 1)
00152     return 1;
00153   else
00154     return 0;
00155 }
00156 void getResInfo(residue* res, int start)
00157 {
00158   int atmTot = 0;int resNum,thisRes;int i = start;int j = 0;
00159   char name [10];char* temp;char* resName = name;
00160   while(isAtom(ln+i) == 0 && i < INWC)
00161    i++;
00162   //Getting the residue name
00163   temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c;
00164   sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00165   (*(res+j)).N = strdup(resName);
00166   //Getting the residue #
00167   temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00168   sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00169   resNum = thisRes;
00170   (*(res+j)).n = resNum;
00171   i = start;
00172   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00173   {
00174     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00175     {
00176       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00177       sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00178       if(thisRes != resNum)
00179       { 
00180         //Setting the total # of atoms on the old res
00181         resNum = thisRes;
00182         (*(res+j)).na = atmTot;
00183         atmTot = 0; j++;
00184         //Getting the residue name for the new res
00185         temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c;
00186         sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00187         (*(res+j)).N = strdup(resName);
00188         //Setting the residue # on the new res
00189         (*(res+j)).n = resNum;
00190       }
00191       else
00192         atmTot++;
00193     }
00194    i++;
00195   }
00196  (*(res+j)).na = atmTot;
00197 }
